item.title: John Stuart Mill
item.description: Freedom Of speech has become somewhat of a cultural caricature – familiar to everyone, yet few seem to truly grasp what it actually is, and fewer still are able to articulate why it’s needed. Ironically, it’s become the very sort of empty convention Mill warns us widely-accepted truths run the risk of becoming when they go unquestioned for too long. Everyone – I do mean everyone – should read and reflect on the three opening chapters of On Liberty; if not for their own entertainment, then for the benefit of their peers: I really can’t think of another book (and one so short!
